title: Commemorating the 40th Anniversary of Medgar Evers College
fulltext:
LEGISLATIVE  RESOLUTION  commemorating  the  40th  Anniversary of Medgar
Evers College

WHEREAS, It is the sense of  this  Legislative  Body  to  recognize  and
commend  those  exemplary  institutions  of  higher education within the
State of New York for  their  enduring  commitment  to  the  pursuit  of
academic excellence; and
  WHEREAS,  Attendant to such concern and fully in accord with its long-
standing traditions, this Legislative Body is justly  proud  to  commem-
orate  the  40th  Anniversary  of  Medgar Evers College on September 28,
2010, in Brooklyn, New York; and
  WHEREAS, Located in the heart of Brooklyn, Medgar Evers College  is  a
senior  college  of  The City University of New York that was founded in
1970 as a result of collaborative efforts by community leaders,  elected
officials,  the Chancellor and the Board of Trustees of The City Univer-
sity of New York; and
  WHEREAS, The College is named in honor of civil rights  leader  Medgar
Wiley  Evers,  a man who made the ultimate sacrifice in the pursuit of a
better quality of life for people of African descent across this Nation;
and
  WHEREAS, For the past 40 years,  Medgar  Evers  College  has  provided
quality  higher educational opportunities in Central Brooklyn and today,
the College is fulfilling the vision of its founding community  leaders;
and
  WHEREAS,  Thousands  upon  thousands  of  students have graduated from
Medgar Evers College to become  leaders  in  business,  government,  the
arts, science and education; and
  WHEREAS,  With  a  significant  enrollment of students from the United
States, Africa, the Caribbean and Latin America, Asia  and  Europe,  its
highly  talented  faculty  as well as its international programs, Medgar
Evers College stands on the cutting edge of globalization; and
  WHEREAS, World leaders regularly  address  the  Medgar  Evers  College
community through major conferences, meetings and cultural performances;
and
  WHEREAS,  Medgar  Evers College collaborates with NASA's Space Program
and has an Aeronautics Laboratory that promotes learning in science  and
technology; and
  WHEREAS,  Always  looking  to  the  future,  Medgar  Evers College has
embarked on substantial  new  campus  construction  and  renovations  to
expand  and  enhance  its  academic  programs,  research  and  community
services; and
  WHEREAS, Over the past five years, Medgar Evers has experienced a  35%
enrollment  increase,  including  its highest enrollment ever this year,
with over 7,000 students registered during the Fall  and  Spring  semes-
ters;  they  include  accomplished scholars, such as its Business School
students who captured first place in the Third Annual Wharton Undergrad-
uate Marketing Conference case competition at The University of Pennsyl-
vania Wharton School of Business; the new inductees for the  Lambda  Rho
Chapter of Delta Mu Delta International Honors Society; and students who
have  presented  original research at conferences in San Antonio, Texas,
San Francisco, California, Seattle,  Washington  and  San  Juan,  Puerto
Rico, among other venues during the past year; and
  WHEREAS, Under the leadership of its current President, Dr. William L.
Pollard,  the  College  is  working  to become the most student-centered
College in CUNY and beyond; and

  WHEREAS, As Medgar Evers College celebrates its 40th  Anniversary,  it
stands  in fulfillment of the proud legacy of its namesake and is poised
for success for many years to come; now, therefore, be it
  RESOLVED,  That  this  Legislative  Body pause in its deliberations to
commemorate the 40th Anniversary of Medgar  Evers  College;  and  be  it
further
  RESOLVED, That a copy of this Resolution, suitably engrossed, be tran-
smitted  to  Dr.  William L. Pollard, President, Medgar Evers College of
The City University of New York.
